author: Reuters Editorial
title: Euro trims losses after Draghi's comments on euro zone economy
text:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - The euro pared some losses against the dollar on Monday after European Central Bank President Mario Draghi said the euro zone economy has strengthened enough to lift regional inflation towards the ECBâ€™s 2-percent goal.
At 11:18 a.m. (1618 GMT), the single currency was
down 0.40 percent at $1.2410, which was below a three-year peak of $1.2536 set on Jan. 25, Reuters data showed.
Reporting by Richard Leong
